subject: RE: [junit] Using Mock objects or another system?
msgSnippet: ... From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@rogers.com] Sent: 10 April 2003 16:33 To: junit@yahoogroups.com Subject: Re: [junit] Using Mock objects or another
messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
Sent: 10 April 2003 16:33
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Using Mock objects or another system?


It is best to do both, at different times, for different reasons and often by different people.

So said javainsel on 4/10/2003 --------------------
A coworker suggested that we don't use Mock objects because he thinks
that it is better to test everything together (code, framework,
application server and database).
<snip />
J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
